text: what are junior doctors the terms
actually a little misleading many
doctors will spend over a decade as a
junior they represent about a third of
the medical workforce at the start of
their careers they learn over 30,000
pounds but by the end this can top
70,000 pounds but they will be making
life-and-death decisions what is a
dispute about then it's complicated
being in that shell a new contract the
government wants to make changes but
doctors are concerned they're not going
to be paid enough for working weekends
and limits on the number of hours they
work aren't strong enough and are
potentially dangerous how did we get
here it's been a long-running dispute
talks first started in 2012 but it
really came to a head last summer when
the government said it did impose a
contract on doctors strikes were called
after 98% voted in favor of a walkout
but they were called off at the last
minute and talks restarted but they've
now failed and the strikes are back on
so how will patients be affected on
strike days it's expected the strike
will largely hit non-emergency care such
as knee and hip operations a knees will
be operational as will GP surgeries you
should have already been told if your
treatment has been cancelled
